all the information of this page are taken from the Okta pricing site: https://www.okta.com/pricing

Solutions

Okta offers two solutions, to avoid confusion, we should know which solution we want to use:

Workforce Identity

"Protect and enable employees, contractors, partners" → Not our use case, this is the model how Thoughtworks is using Okta.
Every employee, contractor or partner gets an organizational account and can sign in to applications to do his/her daily business.

Customer Identity

"Build secure, seamless experiences" → This is the solution we are looking for. Okta acts as an Identity Provider for users of our application landscape.


Products

The customer identity solution offers three "products". Products differ in features and price but are basically the "same" product.

The products range from "Developer" over "One App" to "Enterprise" and by looking at the features it quite clear that we fall into the Enterprise package.

The feature why we need Enterprise:

  • Custom applications
    • One App: 5 OIDC Clients
    • Enterprise: Unlimited OIDC and SAML applications
    • Explanation: Each EFS installation, Portal, etc. is one custom application.


Question

Does this mean that we get Okta Verify free for every user ?


Included in all packages: Basic multi-factor authentication with Okta Verify

Enterprise List price starting at $42K annually

Add ons

GreenYes We need this add on to achieve planned goals

YellowYES We could need this feature, but also live without it if not possible

RedNO This add on is not needed to achieve the planned goals

Blue$XXXX Annual List price (starting at)


Update: This list contains the current information as of 23.09.2019


API Access Management  GreenYES Blue$8000

  • This add on has nothing to do with Automation via API, its actually meant to have a better option when it comes to securing your own APIs
  • Unlimited OAuth 2.0 authorization servers → The most important feature of this add on. Could be a nice to have and no hard requirement

Inbound Federation GreenYES  Blue$8000

  • Not exactly clear what this means. Need to check again with Okta.
  • Also just mentions SAML which is confusing

Multi Factor Authentication GreenYES Blue$8000

  • Enables more options for MFA (other than Okta Verify)
  • Also an option for Adaptive MFA for $16,000 which we dont need (advanced policies for MFA)

SSO Integrations RedNo Blue$2000

  • Enables the usage of apps in the Okta Integration Network

Lifecycle Management GreenYES Blue$10000

  • Group membership rules sounds like the only "usefull" feature for us. Need to check again with Okta.
  • Edit: After a second meeting with Okta → We need this

Directory Integration RedNo Blue$21000

  • Not needed if clients use an own IdP
  • If we assume clients only have ADs,LDAPs in place, then it could be usefull


Features we need

  • Groups + Group-Rules
  • Custom Applications (OIDC/OAuth2.0 + SAML)
    • Application Assignments to Groups/Users/other more specific filters
  • Password Policies
  • Multifactor Authentication based on groups (at least: Google Authenticator, SMS, FIDO nice to have) + Factor Enrollment
  • flexible nubmer of Identity Providers (at least OpenID Connect, SAML, social providers) + Routing Rules + JIT Provisioning [Federation]
  • flexible number of custom Authorization Servers
  • full API Access
  • Logging/Monitoring/Events/Notifications
  • Customizations
    • Appearance, Texts
    • Custom Pages/Login Widget (whitelabel)
  • Enable/Disable Dashboard for users
  • Self Service
  • SSO
    • Single Session for a user accross all applications/authorization servers
  • SLAs + Support
  • Mutliple organizations/environments (like test/staging environments with one production environment)
  • Custom domains


TO DISCUSS:

  • SLAs
  • Directory Integration (this is a strategical product decission - we need to fully understand what is meant by this)
